For a directed graph <math display="inline">G</math> we say that a sequence <math display="inline">\left( u_{1}, u_{2},  \dots ,u_{t - 1},u_{t} \right)</math> , (where <math display="inline">u_{1}= r</math> and <math display="inline">u_{t}= x</math>) of distinct vertices is called a directed path from <math display="inline">r</math> to <math display="inline">x</math> when <math display="inline">u_{i} \mathrel{\bullet  \!\!\! \rightarrow} u_{i + 1}</math> is a directed edge in <math display="inline">G</math> <math display="inline">\forall i \in \left\{ 0, \ldots, t-1 \right\}</math>
